metro.TrainManagement.Nodes

Class RailwayNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • metro.TrainManagement.Nodes.RailwayNode

  • public class RailwayNode
extends java.lang.Object
    A railway node is a point that's used by train lines. Every node has neighbors (both know each other) and by drawing a railway node, lines are drawed to these neighbors.
    Author:
    hauke

        public void addSimple(RailwayNode node)

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch sp,
        java.awt.Point offset)
        Draws a railway node and its neighbors. An algorithm takes care of NOT drawing nodes twice.
        Parameters:
        sp - The sprite batch.
        offset - An map offset in pixel.

      • drawColoredLines

        private void drawColoredLines(java.awt.Point position,
                    java.awt.Point positionNext,
                    java.awt.Point nodePosition,
                    java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Color> listOfColors)
        Draws all train lines in their own color.
        Parameters:
        position - The position with offset.
        positionNext - The position of the next node (also with offset).
        nodePosition - The node position (in fields, not pixel).
        listOfColors - List of all colors of this track.

      • addColorTo

        public void addColorTo(RailwayNode node,
              java.awt.Color color)
        Adds a color to the connection "this node" <--[color]--> "parameter node".
        Parameters:
        node - The other node with same color.
        color - The color of both nodes.

      • removeColorTo

        public void removeColorTo(RailwayNode node,
                 java.awt.Color color)
        Removes the connection "this node" <--[color]--> "parameter node".
        Parameters:
        node - The neighbor node with the same color.
        color - The color of these nodes.

      • removeColor

        public void removeColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Removes a specific color from this node.
        Parameters:
        color - The color to remove.

      • changeColor

        public void changeColor(java.awt.Color oldColor,
               java.awt.Color newColor)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Replaces all colors to a new color. This method may throw an IllegalArgumentException when the newColor is already in use!
        Parameters:
        oldColor - The color to replace.
        newColor - The new color.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception when the user selected a color that has already been taken (exception because no duplicate colors are allowed).

      • isEndOfLine

        public boolean isEndOfLine(java.awt.Color colorOfLine)
        Checks if this node is the end/start node of the train line specified by the given color.
        Parameters:
        colorOfLine - The color of the train line this node may be an end/start node.
        Returns:
        True when it's an end/start node.
